citeinfo.origin: Washington State Department of Ecology Toxics Cleanup Program
citeinfo.title: SEDQUAL - Sediment Quality Information System

abstract.p: SEDQUAL is used to access sediment toxicity. Although it is not available online, you can download a copy to your local drive. SEDQUAL includes a SQL Server database, a user interface, and integrated GIS components. It contains roughly 8,500 sample collection stations, 13,000 sediment sample records, 688,000 chemical analysis records, 141,000 benthic infauna analysis records, and 36,000 bioassay analysis records.
The fifth public release of SEDQUAL, is now being distributed on CD-ROM by request by sending the appropriate contact information to: mpay461@ecy.wa.gov.

descript.purpose: To provide federal, state and local natural resource regulatory organizations, academic institutions and other environmental stakeholders with a tool to assess sediment toxicity in sub-tidal marine and freshwater environments.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
